Add a column of q values to account for multiple comparisons

add_q.tbl_uvregression.Rd

The adjustments to the p-values is performed with stats::p.adjust.

# S3 method for tbl_uvregression
add_q(x, method = "fdr",
  pvalue_fun = x$inputs$pvalue_fun, ...)

Arguments

x

tbl_uvregression object
method

character argument. Methods from stats::p.adjust are accepted. Default is method = 'fdr'.
pvalue_fun

function to round and format p-values. Default is style_pvalue. The function must have a numeric vector input (the numeric, exact p-value), and return a string that is the rounded/formatted p-value (e.g. pvalue_fun = function(x) style_pvalue(x, digits = 2) or equivalently, purrr::partial(style_pvalue, digits = 2)).
...

further arguments passed to or from other methods

Example Output

See also

Other tbl_uvregression tools: add_global.tbl_uvregression, add_nevent.tbl_uvregression, bold_italicize_labels_levels, inline_text.tbl_uvregression, tbl_merge, tbl_uvregression

Examples

tbl_uvr_q_ex <-
  trial %>%
  dplyr::select(age, marker, grade, response) %>%
  tbl_uvregression(
    method = lm,
    y = age
  ) %>%
  add_global() %>%
  add_q()
